text: Minous monodactylus (grey stingfish) (Bloch & J. G. Schneider, 1801) is a species of stingfish found in the Indo-Pacific particularly Red Sea, East Africa, Indonesia and Japan. It is found near shore and inhabits soft bottoms of the continental shelf. It is not evaluated by the IUCN or CITES and is venomous to humans. == References == Category:Fish of Thailand Category:Fish described in 1801 Category:Scorpaenidae
title: Minous monodactylus
